channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipped Carpet, 26th January
item.description:
This red rolled up carpet has been dumped outside Evelina Court Evelina Road Penge. Itâ€™s been there 3 weeks so down to me to report it.

item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (non-offensive)

item.title: Large chipboard dumped, 26th January
item.description:
Large piece of chip board that has soaked through with water and is stuck to the pavement. It is a trip and slip hazard and and is unsightly. It is just to the right of the entrance gates to Regent Studios and left of the council depot.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Andrews Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wholesale accumulation of anything and everything, 26th January
item.description:
Numerous vehicles piled high and full of rubbish. No end of old bicycles chained to street furniture (railings) with for sale sign overlooking traffic at the lights. Issues concerning this location have been reported for years, yet no evidence that anything has been done to rectify the matter. Previous reports have been deleted, some indicating that the problem has been fixed. But clearly not. Absolute eyesore. Not sure what visitors to the Royal Borough might think.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Edge Hill, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken vacuum cleaner parts, 26th January
item.description:
Vacuum parts left lying around for months

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Killearn Road, Catford South, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amounts of dog poo, 26th January
item.description:
There is a man who is letting his dog foul all over the street and the shared garden/ pathways around Westbrook Court flats/ on Kidbrooke grove/ on Westbrook Road and on the corner of Westbrook rd and Kidbrooke grove. This has been happening for 2-3 weeks now and the whole area on the street and on the paths and garden of the shared area in the Westbrook court flats is covered in numerous large piles of dog faeces.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kidbrooke Grove, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping on Chai Walk, 26th January
item.description:
More rubbish piling up on Chai Walk. Some timber and drawers left for a few days, now more timber and a stool/side table have been added over the weekend.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mount Pleasant Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive unavoidable pothole which has burst my front tyre and caused damage to car, 26th January
item.description:
It's clear the road has already been patched but this is a deep hole impossible to see until it can't be avoided. I don't live in Chislehurst and had to leave my car at my parents' house to await repair. This may have been reported by others but there are many potholes in this road, this one is very dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashfield Lane, Chislehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drop kerbs needed on the pavement on either side of the Iceland loading road at the back of the Iceland shop - leading directly onto Colomb Street- mobility scooters and wheelchairs cannot cross the pavement edge either side, it is very close to the access crossing, 26th January
item.description:
See above- reported in person to Cllr Maisie Richards Cottrell about 2 months ago.

item.title: Bags with leaves not collected, 26th January
item.description:
At the intersection of Melling Street and Flaxton Road, there is a recurring issue with the timely collection of bags containing leaves. When these bags are not collected promptly, additional waste accumulates on top of them, resulting in piles of refuse.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Flaxton Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet
